subject: Re: [junit] Re: How to log JUnits Tests
msgSnippet: As a corrolary, i ve seen many a test that when you boiled it down to its essence, proved that some third party api worked as advertised. ... From: Cédric
messageBody:
As a corrolary, i've seen many a test that when you boiled it down to its essence, proved that some third party api worked as advertised.


----- Original Message -----
From: Cédric Beust ?
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Sunday, September 24, 2006 6:24 PM
Subject: Re: [junit] Re: How to log JUnits Tests


On 9/24/06, j_cumps <j_cumps@...> wrote:
>
> > Interesting. So you don't trust your test?
>
> I trust my tests. But I like to show other people what my tests did.

Logging can also be useful to make sure your tests do what you think they
do.

On more than one occasion, I have written tests that passed because they...
did nothing at all.

Which makes me think that it might be useful to have a FindBugs-like tool
for tests that would make sure that each of your tests have at least one
assert...

--
Cédric
http://testng.org
